lines.text: Ack! Ack! Ack!
They blew up Congress! Ha ha ha ha!
I want the people to know that they still have 2 out of 3 branches of the government working for them, and that ain't bad.
Why can't we work out our differences? Why can't we work things out? Little people, why can't we all just get along?

All green of skin... 800 centuries ago, their bodily fluids include the birth of half-breeds. For the fundamental truth self-determination of the cosmos, for dark is the suede that mows like a harvest.
What the hell does that mean?
I want to thank my Grandma for always being so good to me, and, and for helping save the world and everything.
HEY! You're Tom Jones Right? "It ain't unusual", Hey Tom, Tom! Can I have an autograph? Anyone Got A Pen?
[Challenging a Martian to a fistfight]
No weapons! No tricks! Just you and me! Byron Williams! The heavyweight champion of the world!
What do you think, Marcia?
Kick the crap out of 'em.
You wanna conquer the world, you're going to need lawyers, right?

[after a Martian's head explodes]
I think it must be my music!
Should I go get Grandma?
Oh forget Grandma! She's halfway into space already!
Don't run! We are your friends!

[as the chandelier is falling on her]
The Nancy Reagan chandelier!
[last lines]
Is that OK?
Yea. Do you got a girlfriend?
No.
[Watching an alien on TV]

[after seeing the Martians for the first time]
I'm not allowing that thing in my house.
Sweetie, we may have to. The people expect me to meet with them.
Well they're not going to eat off the Van Buren china.
Hello, my name is Barbara,
Hello Barbara,
I am an alcoholic, but I haven't had a drink in three months!
Liberals! Intellectuals! Peacemongers! IDIOTS!

[Opening the door in the background]
Can you keep it down? People live here!
[Closes the door]
Even in a time of intergalactic crisis, people still want to roll them bones.
I bet you're psyched about the Martians coming Grandma? I mean, you've seen a lot of crazy stuff already. Everyone must have been real scared when they invented the train!
Come on kid I'm not that old!
Die, you alien shithead!
Richie, I think these guys are very sick.
Martians. Ha ha. Funny looks little critters, aren't they?

[as Taffy is giving her the Medal of Honor]
Thank you, honey. But don't you dare let anything like this happen again.

[about to get on the bus to leave for the Army, to his brother]
So long, retard.
Jason, hi. It's me.
Are you wearing a bra?
Bye bye, Grandma.
Goodbye, Thomas.
It's Billy Glenn, Grandma.
I know, Thomas.
We know they're extremely advanced technologically, which suggests - very rightfully so - that they're peaceful. An advanced civilization, by definition, is not barbaric.
I'm not a crook, I'm ambitious. There's a difference.
Wow, he just made the international sign of the doughnut.
Barbara, you alright?
Huh? I need a drink...
You and me both baby!
[Pitching a hotel-casino idea]
If the Martians land, the're gonna need a place to stay. Just like everybody else.
Rest assured that we will soon come out at a very real outcome.
General Decker, if you do not shut up I am going to relieve you of your commands
We have to strike now, sir! Annihilate! Kill! Kill! Kill!
SHUT UP! SHUT UP! SHUT UP!

[talking on phone]
Hello? This is General Casey. I get to meet the Martian Ambassador! Ain't that great? Oh, it's a hell of an honor. But didn't I always tell you honey, if I just stayed in place and never spoke up, good things are bound to happen. Yeah... Ok
[makes kissing noises and ends the phone call]
[overhearing the destruction of France via telephone]
...Mon dieu...
We should nuke these assholes with everything we got, sir.
Guess it wasn't the dove.
What are you guys gawking at? Get that president outta here!
I'll tell you one thing, they ain't gettin' the TV.
Know anyone who can fly a plane?
Yeah, your husband Art.
No... he's dead. I told him this was gonna happen.
We come in peace! We come in peace!

[after running into a martian]
Holy shit!

[as the Martians disintegrate the Congressmen]
Mr. Ambassador, please! What are you doing? This doesn't make sense! It's not logical! It's not -
[a Martian knocks out the Professor]
My finger!

[to Jerry Ross]
When the Martians land, will the press have access? Can we do interviews?

[Reporting in Pahrump where the Martians are landing]
The teeming masses have gathered from who knows how many states. Waiting and watching. Why have they come? Curiosity? Or is it something more? Or is it simply to say "I was there. I was there when first man met Martian." Jason Stone, GNN. Pahrump.

[after watching the Martians kill Congress on TV]
Why did they do that?
Maybe they no liking the human being.
Do you have to drink in front of me?
You're an adult. Cope.
I'd been thinkin' about Mars when there wasn't no Mars.

[In the White House]
They don't know what the hell they're talking about. Liberals, intellectuals... peacemongers, IDIOTS!

[coming out of her bedroom]
Would you please keep it down? People live here.

[Repeatedly]
Wow!
